channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Self-isolation rules to ease for double jabbed
item.description: Fully vaccinated contacts of positive Covid cases will not have to isolate from 7 August.

item.title: Callum Jones, 20, left paralysed after running into sea
item.description: Callum Jones ran into the water and hit something beneath the surface.

item.title: Blind people in Wales frustrated by Covid vaccine access
item.description: Those living with sight disabilities criticise accessibility to information and jab centres.

item.title: Llanelli boy 'didn't get enough support' from school before death
item.description: Byron John says his son Bradley "had a future that he wanted and yearned for".

item.title: Bangor: Fire at BT building leaves people without internet and phone
item.description: Nobody was hurt and the "vast majority" of broadband services were not affected, BT says.

item.title: Sacked Dyfed-Powys Police PC made sexual comments about public
item.description: PC Simon England was struck off after his force appealed against an earlier decision not to sack him.

item.title: LGBTQ: Wales' bid to be 'most friendly' nation in Europe
item.description: A new plan aims to make Wales "the most LGBTQ+ friendly" nation in Europe.

item.title: Olympics: Headstone bid for champion in unmarked grave
item.description: Cecil Griffiths died in poverty and his family could not afford a headstone for the relay winner.

item.title: Storm Evert: Yellow warning for wind on south Wales coast
item.description: A yellow warning for wind covers large parts of the south Wales coast on Thursday and Friday.

item.title: Covid case rate falls for eighth consecutive day
item.description: Figures show 18 of Wales' 22 local authority areas are seeing a drop in case rates among under-25s.

item.title: Pilot's frustration at hotel quarantine during family bereavement
item.description: Ryan Harris' tried to appeal so he could help search for his father-in-law but was refused.

item.title: Bradley John 'should be coming up to his 18th birthday'
item.description: Father of Bradley John, 14, says the fact he "took his life" at school is "very, very symbolic".

item.title: Talking Books Wales: How one woman helped so many blind people read
item.description: After losing her sight in her 30s, Rhian Evans says she "used that disability" to help others.

item.title: LGBTQ people 'need to be part of' Wales' awareness push
item.description: It is hoped a new plan will see LGBTQ+ rights made mainstream across schools and the public sector.

item.title: Welsh slate landscape crowned a World Heritage site
item.description: The slate landscape of north-west Wales becomes the 32 UK site to be on Unesco's heritage list.

item.title: Woman who died in 'severe' pain at Cardiff home waited 'hours' for ambulance
item.description: John Whale's wife Maria died after they waited more than two hours for an ambulance.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Matt Richards’ parents ‘overwhelmed’ by gold medal
item.description: "We're just delighted for him", says Matt Richards' mother Amanda.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB men's eight take bronze, Vicky Thornley fourth
item.description: Great Britain fail to win an Olympic rowing gold for the first Games since 1980 as the men's eight crew claim bronze.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's rower Vicky Thornley misses out on bronze medal in single sculls
item.description: Team GB's Vicky Thornley narrowly misses out on a bronze medal as she finishes fourth in the single sculls at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: South Africa v British & Irish Lions: Rassie Erasmus complains about refereeing in video monologue
item.description: South Africa boss Rassie Erasmus records an hour-long video monologue railing against the refereeing in his side's first-Test defeat by the British and Irish Lions.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's men's eight crew win bronze medal in 'incredible' final
item.description: Team GB's men's eight crew win bronze in the final race of the Tokyo 2020 regatta, being narrowly pipped to silver by Germany as New Zealand take gold.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Welsh swimming golden boy Matthew Richards targets more success
item.description: Welsh swimming Olympic champion Matthew Richards is already targeting more gold medal success in the pool.

item.title: Tân BT Bangor yn torri cysylltiadau ffôn a band eang
item.description: Chafodd neb anaf, medd BT a does dim effaith i "fwyafrif helaeth" eu gwasanaethau band eang.

item.title: Dim angen hunan-ynysu os ydych wedi'ch brechu'n llawn
item.description: Llywodraeth Cymru'n cyhoeddi newid i'r rheolau ar hunan-ynysu fydd mewn grym o 7 Awst ymlaen.

item.title: Dinasyddion yr UE 'angen ymgeisio dros eu plant'
item.description: Mae dal yn bosib i rieni geisio i'w plant gael aros yng Nghymru er taw 30 Mehefin oedd y dyddiau cau.

item.title: Ble mae Safleoedd Treftadaeth UNESCO Cymru?
item.description: Y mannau yng Nghymru sydd wedi ennill statws treftadaeth rhyngwladol

item.title: Cyngres Europa: Y Seintiau drwodd ond Cei Connah allan
item.description: Y Seintiau'n rhoi crasfa i dîm o Lithwania, ond Cei Connah allan er gwaethaf buddugoliaeth.
